title: The Journal of Sir Walter Scott; From the Original Manuscript at Abbotsford
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: About two o'clock enter two gentlemen inan open carriage, both from Makerstoun, and both Captains in the Navy.

title: The Journal of Sir Walter Scott; From the Original Manuscript at Abbotsford
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: At twelve o'clock set out with Anne and Walter to visit at Makerstoun,but the road between Makerstoun and Merton being very bad, we drove, Idare say, thirty miles in going and coming, by a circuitous route, andonly got home at half-past seven at night.

title: Seeing Europe with Famous Authors, Volume 2; Great Britain and Ireland, Part 2
author: Francis W. Halsey
snippet: Here his dust lies amid the objectsredolent of his fame; and within a few miles, near Makerstoun, a viewmay he obtained, from a hill, of Smailholme Tower, where the poet passedsome of the years of his boyhood, and the memory of which he hasperpetuated in one of the epistles which introduce each Cantoof Marmion.
